byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

abstract: Syrian government forces backed by Russian air power move to retake Palmyra from Islamic State, which has deliberately destroyed some of city's prized ancient ruins; regaining control of strategically important city would also provide crucial political boost in fight against militant group.
lead_paragraph: Government troops and allied militias, backed by intensive Russian airstrikes, are fighting to retake the city, along with its majestic ancient ruins.

headline.main: Syrian Forces and ISIS Clash at Edge of Palmyra
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces and ISIS Clash at Edge of Ancient Palmyra

snippet: Government troops and allied militias, backed by intensive Russian airstrikes, are fighting to retake the city, along with its majestic ancient ruins.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
